bibl.title: The figure of Apollos, father of Dioscorus, in the light of Coptic letters from sixth-century Aphrodito
bibl.seg: Loreleï Vanderheyden, The Figure of Apollos, Father of Dioscorus, in the Light of Coptic Letters From Sixth-Century Aphrodito.

Sabine R. Huebner, Eugenio Garosi, Isabelle Marthot-Santaniello, Matthias Müller, Stefanie Schmidt & Matthias Stern (edd.), Living the End of Antiquity. Individual Histories from Byzantine to Islamic Egypt = Studien zu Kultur und Geschichte des ersten Jahrtausends n.Chr. / Studies in the Culture and History of the First Millennium C.E. 84 (Berlin - Boston, 2020) pp. 119-128, fig.

Apollos as Village Headman (prōtokōmētēs). - Apollos as the Founder of his own Monastery and a Secular Apa. - Apollos as Administrator (dioikētēs) of a large Landowner. - Apollos as a Family Man. - Apollos' Coptic Handwriting. - Apollos' Bilingualism.
